bibl.title: Implicit Models of Cross-Cultural Interaction: A Question of Noses, Soap, and Prejudice.
bibl.note: The question of Egyptian-Greek relations in Ptolemaic Egypt. Clear evidence of any sort of racial or cultural chauvinism is exceedingly rare.

bibl.title: Life in a Multi-Cultural Society: Egypt from Cambyses to Constantine and Beyond

bibl.seg: RITNER Robert K., Implicit Models of Cross-Cultural Interaction: A Question of Noses, Soap, and Prejudice.
Janet H. JOHNSON (Ed.), Life in a Multi-Cultural Society: Egypt from Cambyses to Constantine and Beyond = SAOC. 51 (Chicago, 1992) pp. 283-290.
The question of Egyptian-Greek relations in Ptolemaic Egypt. Clear evidence of any sort of racial or cultural chauvinism is exceedingly rare.
